title: Deceased Estate with COVID Extension

scenario_info.name: Deceased Estate with COVID Extension
scenario_info.description: Peter's mother passed away in March 2020. Due to COVID-19 restrictions on real estate activities, he was unable to sell the property within 2 years. The ATO provides automatic extensions for delays caused by COVID-19 government restrictions.

expected_result.notes: COVID extension applies - sold 3.4 years after death but still qualifies for 2-year rule

applicable_rules: PCG 2019/5: Automatic extension for qualifying circumstances
More than 12 months of delay within first 2 years = Automatic extension
Peter did not need to apply for extension
If COVID extension didn't apply, partial exemption would calculate from date of death

property_history.description: Mother's original purchase - was her main residence
Mother passes. Property was her main residence. COVID-19 pandemic begins.
Peter receives property as beneficiary. COVID restrictions prevent sale.
COVID restrictions ease. 22 months of restrictions qualify for automatic extension.

properties.notes: Full exemption with COVID extension. Sold 3.4 years after death, but 22 months of COVID restrictions qualify for automatic extension under PCG 2019/5. 2-year rule effectively extended.

user_query: My mother passed away in March 2020 and left me her home. I couldn't sell during COVID lockdowns. I finally sold in August 2023. Is it still exempt under the 2-year rule?
